invariants.statement: Ξ-synthesis produces a globally closed description over all lower tiers; no new primitive tiers are introduced.
invariants.formal: Ξ acts only by reorganizing, summarizing, or indexing the existing tier structure, not by creating new primitive operators.

invariants.statement: Ξ-resolved structures must be consistent with all upstream invariants by construction.
invariants.formal: If B\_Ξ is a Ξ-synthesized object, then for every component Box B' referenced by B\_Ξ, B' is Ω-normalized and ρ-layer consistent.
